title.narrative: EEPBIP – Energy Efficiency in Public Buildings and Infrastructure Programme

description.narrative: South Africa aims at catalysing energy efficient (EE) transformation in public sector buildings and infrastructure like street lighting, traffic lights, water supply and wastewater treatment. A comprehensive national framework is established for policy and market transformation. The NAMA Support Project (NSP) supports this by using the procurement potential of the public sector to strengthen the market for Energy Service Companies (ESCOs) as agents for EE investment. It improves access to financial services for ESCOs through the banking sector by establishing a guarantee fund and incorporates already existing expertise in identifying EE potentials in public buildings and infrastucture into which ESCO investment is invited. It uses NAMA Facility funding to mobilise public and private sector investments in a 1:4.5 ratio over 5 years. It contributes to coordination among national departments and with local government, leading to a mitigation of 3,123 ktCO2 after 5 years.
